publications.name: Non-monotonic effect of Stokes number on turbulence modulation in particle-laden channel flow. J. Fluid Mech
publications.summary: Four-way coupled PP-DNS reveals that increasing particle inertia shifts the flow from drag enhancement to reduction before asymptotically recovering the single-phase state. In the statistical sense, competition between particle-induced extra transport and extra dissipation at various aspects is identified as the drivers of turbulence modulation, leveraging a comprehensive two-phase statistical description derived in this work. The particle inertial effects are elucidated by examining the limit behaviors (St to 0 or âˆž) analytically.

publications.name: GPU acceleration of four-way coupled PP-DNS for compressible particle-laden wall turbulence
publications.summary: A multi-GPU acceleration strategy is proposed to enable efficient four-way coupled PP-DNS of particle-laden turbulence, demonstrating the feasibility and significance of capturing four-way coupling effects with large particle numbers.

publications.name: Reduced-order variational mode decomposition to reveal transient and non-stationary dynamics in fluid flows
publications.summary: A novel modal analysis method named RVMD is proposed, inspired by the Hilbert-Huang transform and variational mode decomposition, to extract coherent structures in fluid flows. The combination of RVMD and Hilbert spectral analysis leads to a modal-based time-frequency analysis framework in the Hilbert view, providing a potentially powerful tool to discover, quantify, and analyse the low-order dynamics featured by transient and/or nonstationary properties in complex flow problems.
